subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Impact Investing: Money with a Mission
description: A short lesson to help you apply Impact Investing: Money with a Mission.

hook.text: What if your investments could earn returns and fix the world? Impact investing says you don't have to choose.

buildup.text: Traditional investing ignores social harm. Philanthropy ignores returns. Impact investing bridges both worlds.

discovery.text: The Rockefeller Foundation coined the term in 2007, arguing that capital markets could drive social change.

twist.text: Impact investing grew from a niche idea to a $1.2 trillion market in barely fifteen years.

climax.text: Today pension funds, banks, and governments invest for impact. Doing good became a real asset class.

punchline.text: Your portfolio can change the world and still grow.

quiz.question: What organization coined the term 'impact investing' in 2007?
